extendedInfo.description: An internationally proven Bible reading program thatâs achievable and flexible, now on your Android device. The E100 is built around 100 carefully selected Bible passages that can be read in about 10 minutes. The âEâ stands for Essential and each of the Essential 100 readings ranges from a few verses to a few chapters. These passages are organised in a way that will help you develop a big picture understanding of Godâs Word, and include complementary reflections and prayers. Get into Godâs Word, get real understanding, and develop your daily habit of reading the Bible. - 100 easy-to-read passages that will give you a big picture understanding of the Bible - Choose your timeframe - Choose friends, family, or groups to read it with to keep you enthusiastic and accountable - See your progress in graph form - Record your insights - Select your preferred font size - Includes all readings and a full Bible - Each reading has additional reflections and prayers to help you apply it - A Bible reading program you can do anytime, anywhere, to fit in with your day

reviews.title: Easy to use
reviews.comment: The app works well and is easy to use. I would have been willing to pay extra to use a different version of the text, however the version is OK.
reviews.author: Anna Nelson

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.comment: My church is currently following the E100 plan, and this app seems to be really helping me stay on track.  E100 has chosen a great selection of Scripture passages. I have it on my phone and tablet, and I always have at least one of those with me wherever I go.  I\'m not sure what version of the Bible this app uses, but I\'m not crazy about it - that would be my only complaint.  But, of course, I have the free Bible app so I can read a different version if I want to.  I haven\'t had any problems with the app itself.  My phone is running Gingerbread and my tablet ICS.  It\'s the most expensive app that I\'ve purchased, but I definitely think that it is worth it!
reviews.author: Carrie Davis Ben-Ezra

reviews.title: Good Bible plan
reviews.comment: My church is doing e100 so I happily bought the app. Now I have it, I would happily pay an extra charge to have a different version of the Bible. Just a thought.
reviews.author: Ros Elphick

reviews.title: Brilliant Bible plan
reviews.comment: Be nice if it automatically popped up around the time you say you\'ll use it, and other Bible versions being available would be a bonus.
reviews.author: A Google User
